# drawGrid(inClipRect:)

**Instance Method**

Draws the grid lines within the supplied rectangle.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func drawGrid(inClipRect clipRect: NSRect)
```

## Parameters

- **clipRect**: The rectangle in the table viewâ€™s coordinate system.

## Discussion

Draws the grid lines within `clipRect`, using the grid color set with [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/gridColor].

Subclasses can override this method to draw grid lines other than the standard ones. This method draws a grid regardless of whether the table view is set to draw one automatically.

## Related Documentation

- **intercellSpacing**: The horizontal and vertical spacing between cells.
- **gridColor**: The color used to draw grid lines.

## Drawing

- **drawRow(_:clipRect:)**: Draws the cells for the row at `rowIndex` in the columns that intersect `clipRect`.
- **highlightSelection(inClipRect:)**: Highlights the region of the table view in the specified rectangle.
- **drawBackground(inClipRect:)**: Draws the background of the table view in the clip rect specified by the rectangle.
